pr_title: Add DEBUG logging for undefined role mapping field

timeline.message:
Add DEBUG logging for undefined role mapping field

A role mapping with the following content:

    "rules": { "field": { "userid" : "admin" } }

will never match because `userid` is not a valid field. The correct
field is `username`.

This change adds DEBUG logging when an undefined field is referenced.

The choice to use DEBUG rather than INFO/WARN is that the set of
fields is partially dynamic (e.g. the `metadata.*` fields), so
it may be perfectly reasonable to check a field that is not defined
for that user. For example this rule:

    "rules": { "field": { "metadata.ranking" : "A" } }

would generate a log message for an unranked user, which would
erroneously suggest that such a rule is an error.
This DEBUG logging will assist in diagnosing problems, without
introducing that confusion.

timeline.bodyText: This string format will not be very useful if the value is an array. But I think it can only be primitive values as guaranteed by ExpressionParser#parseFieldValue?
timeline.author: ywangd

replies.bodyText:
Yes, multi-valued expression are a List<FieldValue> rather than a FieldValue over a list/array.
Given that, I don't think it's worth trying to detect an array here. If there was an easily available method for maybeDeepToString(Object) we could call it, but I don't know of one in our codebase.
replies.author: tvernum
